item.title: Learning rust
item.description: First of all, rust is totally new to me. I do not understand what it is trying to resolve. First thing that I have learned is that .. The if statements do not need the paranenthesis. Shows up a weird warning. Should not be strict right.. The semicolon is optional . Sometimes it matters othertimes it does not. This is confusing. println! statement is a macro.
item.content:
First of all, rust is totally new to me.

I do not understand what it is trying to resolve.

First thing that I have learned is that ..

  1. The if statements do not need the paranenthesis. Shows up a weird warning. Should not be strict right..

  2. The semicolon is optional . Sometimes it matters othertimes it does not. This is confusing.

  3. println! statement is a macro.. what does a macro mean..

  4. let mut x = 10 ; and const x : i32 = 10 ;

The constant expressions are written as

const HELLO_WORLD : i32 = 10;

The constant value cannot be evaluated at runtime. Immutable variables can be evaluated during the runtime.

Reached till here during my small session.

https://doc.rust-lang.org/book/ch03-01-variables-and-mutability.html

Decided to skip the guessing_game.

I do not understand match and options and enums yet.

What the fuck are those.

Decided to build a fizz buzz.. The loop keyword is like while loop.. But I am not sure how to write a for loop yet.

item.description: Hi there My name is VibeCoder, this place I use to present my ideas. So, there you have it… enjoy!
